# Niagaros Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge
At Niagaros, we are committed to maintaining a welcoming, inclusive, safe, and professional environment for everyone who participates in our community. We believe that respectful collaboration and open exchange of ideas lead to better products and stronger relationships.

We pledge to make participation in Niagaros free from harassment, intimidation, and discrimination, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, nationality, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity, sexual orientation, or any other personal characteristic.

## Our Standards
Niagaros is a global, professional community. We expect all participants to act in good faith and contribute constructively.

### Examples of Positive Behavior
Community members are encouraged to:

- Be respectful, kind, and empathetic in interactions
- Communicate clearly, thoughtfully, and professionally
- Assume good intent and seek mutual understanding
- Give and gracefully accept constructive feedback
- Focus on collaboration and shared goals
- Respect boundaries, time, and differing perspectives
- Take responsibility for mistakes and work to correct them

### Examples of Unacceptable Behavior
The following behaviors are not tolerated in the Niagaros community:

- Harassment, discrimination, or exclusionary conduct
- Abusive, insulting, demeaning, or inflammatory language
- Personal attacks, political or ideological hostility, or trolling
- Sexualized language or unwelcome sexual attention
- Threats, intimidation, or encouragement of violence or harm
- Publishing or threatening to publish private or confidential information
- Impersonation or misrepresentation of identity or affiliation
- Sustained disruption of discussions, development, or collaboration
- Any behavior that would be considered inappropriate in a professional setting

## Scope
This Code of Conduct applies to all Niagaros-related spaces and interactions, including but not limited to:

- GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, discussions, and reviews
- Documentation, design discussions, and architectural decisions
- Community chat platforms, forums, and social media channels
- Events, meetups, conferences, and virtual gatherings
- Private communications when conducted in the context of Niagaros activities

This Code of Conduct also applies when an individual is representing Niagaros or the Niagaros community in any public or private capacity.

## Enforcement Responsibilities
Niagaros maintainers, core contributors, and designated project leaders are responsible for upholding and enforcing this Code of Conduct. They are empowered to take appropriate corrective action when standards are not met.

Enforcement actions may include removing or editing content, rejecting contributions, restricting participation, or taking other measures deemed necessary to protect the community.

## Enforcement Guidelines
Enforcement decisions will be made with fairness, proportionality, and respect for all parties involved. Actions may include:

- **Guidance or Correction** – A clarification of expectations or request to change behavior
- **Formal Warning** – A clear notice that continued behavior may result in further action
- **Temporary Restrictions** – Temporary suspension or limitation of participation
- **Permanent Removal** – Permanent removal from Niagaros spaces for severe or repeated violations

The severity of the response will depend on the nature, impact, and frequency of the violation.

## Reporting Concerns
If you experience or witness behavior that violates this Code of Conduct, we encourage you to report it.

Reports can be made through:

- A private message to a Niagaros maintainer or core team member
- Email or the officially designated contact

All reports will be reviewed promptly and handled with discretion. Confidentiality will be maintained to the greatest extent possible, and information will only be shared on a need-to-know basis.

## No Retaliation
Niagaros strictly prohibits retaliation against anyone who reports a concern or participates in an investigation in good faith. Retaliation itself constitutes a violation of this Code of Conduct.

## Transparency and Fairness
While individual reports and outcomes may remain confidential, Niagaros strives to apply this Code of Conduct consistently and transparently. Decisions are guided by community safety, professionalism, and long-term project health.

## Attribution
This Code of Conduct is informed by industry best practices, including the GitHub Community Code of Conduct and the Contributor Covenant.

## Questions
If you have questions about this Code of Conduct, its interpretation, or enforcement, please contact the Niagaros team.
